page.title: 07AIR TRAINING CORPS
page.content: The A.T.C. Headquarters is in an old school,which is 100 years old and is situated in Upper Aughton Road.281 squadron were formed in 1941 in Linaker School but in 1946 they changed to the school in Upper Aughton Road,where the Ministry of Defence leased the building.It has been used as an A.T.C. headquarters ever since. The advantages of using an old school are:the ground outside and the main hall are used for drill and parades.Classrooms are utilised as instruction rooms.Usually A.T.C. buildings are houses but 281 squadron have all the advantages of a big school,so there is lots of ground,and can accomodate lots of cadets. They have lots of equipment,an aeroplane cockpit and other general R.A.F. equipment.Squadron 281 do parades and also can go flying.
